lessons.title: What is Geography?
lessons.content: Introduction to the field of geography and its importance in understanding our world.

objectives: Define geography and its main branches
Understand the importance of geographic thinking
Identify key geographic tools and methods

vocabulary.definition: The study of Earth's physical and human features
The study of Earth's natural features
The study of human activities and their impact on Earth

lessons.title: Earth's Features
lessons.content: Exploring Earth's major physical features and landforms.

objectives: Identify major landforms and their characteristics
Understand how physical features affect human activities
Analyze the relationship between geography and climate

vocabulary.definition: A natural feature of Earth's surface
The arrangement of natural and artificial features of an area

lessons.title: Water on Earth
lessons.content: Water is the dominant feature on Earth's surface. This lesson explores the distribution and importance of water resources, including saltwater and freshwater systems, the water cycle, and human impact on water resources.

objectives: Understand the distribution of water on Earth
Identify different types of water bodies and their characteristics
Explain the water cycle and its importance
Analyze human impact on water resources
procedures: Opening: Quick facts about Earth's water
assessments: Analysis of local water usage data
Exit ticket on key water facts

vocabulary.definition: Water that contains little or no salt
Water that contains a high concentration of salt
Large masses of ice that move slowly over land
Water that collects on the surface of the ground
Water found underground in soil and rock
The continuous movement of water through Earth's atmosphere, land, and oceans
